question: Tyler watches TV after he finishes his homework every night. On Saturday and Sunday, he watched a 1-hour episode of his favorite show each night. On Monday, he watched a few episodes of a 30-minute show. On Tuesday, he finished homework early and watched a 4-hour episode and a 60-minute show. On Wednesday, he got to stay up late, so he watched four 1-hour episodes. If he watched 12 hours of TV in all, how many 30-minute episodes did he watch on Monday?
answer:
Let E be the number of episodes he watched on Monday.
After Saturday, he had 12 - 1 = <<12-1=11>>11 hours of TV left.
After Sunday, he had 11 - 1 = <<11-1=10>>10 hours of TV left.
After Tuesday, he had 10 - 4 - 1 = 5 hours of TV left.
After Wednesday, he had 5 - 4 = 1 hours of TV left.
Each 30-minute episode is 1/2 hour.
Thus, E = 1/0.5 = 2 episodes.
